特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
関連科目: カナダ研究入門A、カナダ研究入門B、Topics in Canadian Studies、English for Cross-Cultural Studies A,B(level 3)（担当：矢頭）、Cross-Cultural College Global Career Seminar、カナダの協定校での中期留学、交換留学及びマウント・アリソン大学とのダブル・ディグリーなど
授業の概要・背景: This course is recommended to students who wish to study in Canada.
授業方法:
Classes will be conducted by in-person format in the classroom unless designated otherwise due to unexpected circumstances.
Students should read the assigned reading materials before coming to class. This class will be interactive. The students will be asked to read the assigned material out loud, answer questions, participate in discussions and give presentations. There will also be some take-home assignments.

第1回:
Course introduction
An overview of the provinces and territories of Canada
Definition of Multiculturalism in Canada
第2回:
Lives of ordinary Canadians and immigrants
Discussion: Why do immigrants move to Canada? Why does Canada want to accept so many immigrants?
第3回:
Mini-Presentations by the students about Provinces and Territories of Canada
Basic facts about Canada: Read "Discover Canada"
第5回: How can you become an immigrant to Canada? -The immigration policy of Canada
第6回: How can you become a Canadian? -Applying for citizenship
第7回: Immigration and ethnocultural diversity of Canada
第9回: Media journal presentations by students individually
第11回:
Refugees: their way to Canada, and life after arrival
Watch documentary "Asylum"
第12回: Focus on Japanese Canadians, Chinese Canadians and other ethnic Canadians
第14回: Group presentations about Multiculturalism and Immigration in Canada
トピック.授業外学習2: Students are required to read the designated reading materials before coming to class. They will also have to complete the take-home assignments and prepare for the presentations.
